name: Renaissance Vinoy Resort and Golf Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful, historic hotel. We originally had a king room with a bay view, balcony room. Loved the view but we prefer a suite. None were available with a bayview so we took one with a garden view. It was very spacious and served our needs well. If you go and want a suite, book early and get a bay view room with a balcony. As with any hotel of this caliber, they nickle-and-dime you but all hotels do that anymore, so expect it when you travel. Pros: lovely hotel, veranda with rocking chairs, great location, large swimming pool. Cons: Pricey, no refrigerator in the suite other than the mini-bar, suite in historic part of the bulding was large but not gorgeous.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: This is a beautiful old hotel in a great location. It was perfect for the conference I attended and the staff was great! Especially the front desk and valet staff! Bar employees seemed a bit overwhelmed. Main ballroom is very classic and unique! We will stay again in the future.
reviews.title: Great Conference Hotel

reviews.text: When Traveling to the Saint Petersburg area on Business or if a big golfer, then the Renaissance Vinoy Golf resort is definitely a must stay place! The timeless Historical hotel with its Mediterranean Revival design was the most impressive and expensive in the state of Florida when it opened in the 1920s and has had a long history. Today, almost 87 years later, the Vinoy has been remodeled but retains most of its charm in its location on Tampa Bay, just steps away from Downtown Saint Petersburg.
reviews.title: Good place for Business or Leisure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute you walk into the oversized lobby, one is greeted with grand chandeliers, the original pecky cypress beams have been restored, marble floors and every aspect of the lobby has been redone or refurbished keeping its original grandeur but still attracting today’s modern travelers. The hotel has 2 outdoors pools, a large tennis club with a number of golf courses, a 74 slip marina, a 18-hole golf course, a spa, and a number of restaurants and bar offering fine dining or casual, offering something for everyone.
reviews.title: Beautiful 3 days!
Nice Old Place
reviews.text: I had the opportunity to stay in both the classic rooms at the Vinoy located in the original building and on my second stay, I was upgraded to a larger room in the new guest tower. The guest rooms in the original tower are fairly larger in size and are very comfortable. My room had a large king bed, a dresser, a desk and flat screen tv, along with a chair for relaxing. My room overlooked the marina and downtown offering great views day and night. The room was completed with a coffee pot, the standard Renaissance bathrobes, and a minibar.
eat in the resturant by the pool... the other is too expensive.
reviews.title: very nice hotel.
Romantic Stay with those "damn yankees"
reviews.text: The Vinoy in St. Petersburg is a beautiful Hotel, especially if you are into the Historic Types. The property was extensively renovated and offers to unique types of rooms. We have stayed at this property multiple times, both in the Tower Rooms and The Historic Main Hotel. The Tower rooms all offer a view of Tampa Bay and the South Facing Rooms have a view of St. Petersburg Harbor and Pier. The Tower rooms are newer and a little larger, and are convenient to parking as the garage entrance is adjacent to the elevators that lead to your room. The problem is the rooms are so convenient you could spend entire weekend never walking past the Pool and Spa Facilities to experience the Historic Main Property. We prefer the Main hotel, although the rooms are older, they are very well renovated and if you stay in the south facing of wing rooms you are guaranteed a very decent size room. Unlike most hotels I prefer the limited first floor rooms as they are well off the main public areas, but prevent you from having to deal with the very slow elevators located in the main property. The Hotel offers a lobby coffee bar, a few restaurants and a patio bar, as well as a short walk to many more dining options. The main restaurant Marcan's offers a Sunday brunch $50, hi tea, $14 and Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. The prices for dinner and drinks were decent and on Friday and Saturday Nights they offer live jazz music. I also liked the pub, but I thought the prices were high for dinner and for what you get. The pool bar breakfast is pricey, but they offered nice lunch and snack specials. The Hotel has a nice gift shop and history area, along with fitness facilities and a very 80's pool... straight out of Miami Vice. The property fronts the Bay and the area surrounding the Vinoy, even late at night is very safe. I would recommend walking to the pier or around the shops and restaurants at beachside and 3rd Ave S. As with all old hotels, with the character comes a few annoyances like slow drains and slower AC, but I think it is worth it. Now as with all my reviews I have problems, the front desk staff is always quick to offer you an attitude and if you’re not quick to order a bottle of wine the service in the restaurants becomes slow quick, also the concierge the entire weekend was disinterested. On a positive side the valet and bag service staff was always friendly as well as the staff at the spa. Also if you do choose a room on the western wing be warned, though scenic, the walk from the garage is a good hike. All in all we do like the property, just be prepared to not be sensitive to the attitudes when checking in and the minor difficulties that sometimes come with history. Oh and one more thing, do not stay on a weekend when the Yankees are in town. Even as registered guests, who have no interest in baseball, our traversing through the hotel was made very uncomfortable by both the intrusive security and police and even more intrusive crazy fans and their children trying to acquire photo’s and autographs in the lobby, restaurants, bars and even our room… yes in the middle of the night someone even knocked on our door. Oh by-the-way, the golf course was great!

What a magnificent hotel. From the moment you arrive, you are transported to luxury. The grounds, rooms, public areas, health club, restaurants and lounges are all superior. But what really sets this hotel apart is its staff. Each and every person I encountered during my eight night stay was excellent. From Glenn at the bellstand; to the housekeepers; to the informative concierges; to the pool waiters. Everyone seemed happy to work there and delighted to assist you. I travel over a hundred nights a year and rarely see this level of service.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel with exceptional staff

reviews.text: Other big pluses was the health club: wonderfully equipped including a full schedule of classes and a great locker room facility.
reviews.title: Best in St Petersburg

reviews.text: I had a room in the "historic tower". It was a corner room that was spacious and very well furnished. The bed was very comfortable and there was a lot of closet space.
reviews.title: don't use the shower,...
Good stay but had a few problems!!

reviews.text: We had booked a five night 'special romance package' with the Vinoy which included valet parking. We arrived at 15.30 but were told the room wasn't ready until at least 16.00. We booked in and were given a drinks voucher for $25 which was unexpected and a nice gesture. The room was in the old building and overlooked the Bay. It was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The website does say this room type has twin vanities (sinks - UK) and doesn't have any communicating doors!! Room 549 had one sink and door! We had dinner in Marchants which was very good. The food was excellent. We would advise not booking this hotel at weekends because it's extremely busy with conferences, weddings, dinner etc. It was quite noisy until late!
reviews.title: Beautiful and charming Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our package. We ordered cereal and fruit and eggs etc . After a long wait it all arrived together!!! You have to say you want it course by course!! You have to be very patient at breakfast because service is so slow and frustrating!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel-older with history:)

reviews.text: Our package included a bottle of champagne. We decided to enjoy it on the veranda early one evening. It arrived with some melted chocolate and strawberries.The waiter opened the bottle and we enjoyed a couple of glasses. When my husband looked at the bottle it wasn't Champagne but Cava which was half the price!! When we mentioned this nothing was done. Eventually, when we were paying the bill, two days later, we mentioned it again and the gentleman on reception seemed surprised that we hadn't heard from anyone. He told us to leave it with him and by the time we returned to our room the phone was ringing. It was the restaurant manager and he was extremely apologetic about the mix-up. He knocked the $40 charge off our bill (the cheapest champagne was $80 ) and invited us to have lunch on the hotel. He came down and introduced himself while we were there.
reviews.title: Rooms B, Gym A, Location A, Service A

reviews.text: Our room wasn't serviced on our last full day and when I went to the desk at 3pm the guy at reception told me that housekeeping were there until 5pm so not to worry!!!! That's not good enough!
reviews.title: Beautiful location, needs some TLC

reviews.text: I came to this hotel for a four-day annual meeting for our national association. From the first step inside, the Renaissance Vinoy Resort impressed me with its ambiance, customer service and facilities.
reviews.title: Nearly Perfect Experience

reviews.text: The rooms are large, well-appointed and clean. The beds are very comfortable with quality linens. The bathroom is well stocked and clean. Everything in the room worked the way it was supposed to!
reviews.title: Impressive, I had no idea this hotel would be this fantastic,

reviews.text: The meeting areas and Grand Ballroom are spectacular. The flexibility in setting up meeting rooms, eating areas and reception areas were all outstanding. The portable wall paneling system was amazing. The audio / visual system worked perfectly, every time in every room for all four days.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the staff was very customer-service oriented. The front desk staff even comes out from behind the counter when they give you your room key cards to make that transaction a little more personal. My only negative was the sundry / shop was never open the hours they were supposed to be ... they would open later and close earlier than the posted hours. This made it hard to plan a stop for a snack or something before bedtime.
reviews.title: Fantastic Grand Holtel !!!

reviews.text: I ordered room service twice, and had no problems either time. The food was good and delivered hot and in a timely manner.
reviews.title: The room was huge!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel. Loved the live music they had playing in the lobby in the evening. We had a room in the tower overlooking the water, it was definitely worth getting a balcony to enjoy the beautiful Florida weather. Huge rooms too. It was very easy to walk to all the good restaurants St. Pete has to offer. Also even with it being a cooler day, the pool area is in a spot that the wind is blocked so it was still warm enough to lay out and swim.
reviews.title: Unique hotel

reviews.text: Very well located the Vinoy offers tradition and comfort for a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Traditional Hotel in a Nice Area

reviews.text: The service is good and the area offers several options of Museums, cafes and restaurants.
reviews.title: St.Pete gem

reviews.text: The pool area in very nice and the old architecture brings tradition to our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent but expensive. If you splurge it is worth it.

reviews.text: The only remark is the maintenance that requires more attention in the plumbing drains and overall conservation
reviews.title: Great For Short Family Getaway

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Tampa Bay Rays stadium. The hotel was beautiful and the service was exceptional. We traveled to St. Petersburg Beach, about 15 minutes away, and enjoyed a beautiful day at the beach. The concierge recommended dinner at Columbia's at the Pier, which was very good and the view was amazing. Ice cream to the room for a family of 4 was $50.00, no bargain, but served royally. The only meal we ate in the hotel was brunch on Saturday. Service and food were very good. The pool had plenty of chairs and bar service. If you go during baseball season, the visiting players stay at the hotel. My son enjoyed sitting in the lobby with Toronto Blue Jays and Oakland players.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: A very nice hotel, with their employees as their biggest asset. The room is very clean, with comfortable beds. The pool was great and enjoyable to spend time at. But, it is crazy to charge for wi fi in the rooms. Hotel parking is 14.00. Great location.
reviews.title: very nice historical resort

reviews.text: Yes, the property has a lot of history, but the smell (musty) from the lobby to the rooms was a bit much. I would not say this is a 4 star property, low 3 at the best.
reviews.title: Not What I expected

reviews.text: Service was average at best. Best service was the valet attendants and one bartender/waitress on the promenade July 4th was excellent (wish I had her name).
reviews.title: Old world style, Phenominal Service

reviews.text: Spa was outdated, treatment room felt like it was jammed in an area to say " we have a spa". Not impressed.
reviews.title: No Complimentary Amenities

reviews.text: Beautiful property with a great detail to the renovation of a property made famous in the early 1900's. The staff is extremely attentive and readilly available. The hotel is located on the bay with easy walking access to restaurants etc.....
reviews.title: Fabulous Renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent three nights at the Vinoy and found it everything a hotel of it's reputed class should be. The room was large and well appointed, the bathroom was large and well tiled. We had a view of the bay, the park and boat marina (beautiful). The pool is large and had plenty of chairs and umbrellas. The biggest plus for this hotel is the staff. On every occassion that we approached them they were friendly, courteous and helpful. I couldn't have asked for a more pleasant place to stay.
reviews.title: very impressed

reviews.text: One concern was the tv reception, we were there on a big football weekend and 3 of the 4 network stations had digital problems. So we went to a local pub.
reviews.title: overrated

reviews.text: As for downtown St Pete, it is walkable with shops and restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel.
reviews.title: beautiful place

reviews.text: The hotel can be pricey so check the Marriott web site for discounts. We got a stay 2 nights get one free offer.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: The Hotel is beautiful as were the grounds and the view. Unfortunately, we encountered some serious customer service issues that definitely put a damper on our vacation. Tuesday we took the shuttle ($5 per person) from the Hotel to Tropicana field with no problem. On Wednesday we encountered difficulties on the return trip. The Vinoy posts that they pick up at the Field for an hour after the game. We went to the pick up spot approximately 30 minutes following game time to wait for the shuttle. After waiting a few minutes, we called the Hotel. This is where the incompetence kicked in. The person answering the phone said "Oh, the game is over. They will be there shortly." Waited - no shuttle. Called again. Was told "He made his last run. I'll send him back." Waited - no shuttle. Now we are the only ones standing around Tropicana Field and it's after 11 pm. Call again. This time we're told, "He is just dropping people off; he will be right back." No shuttle. Call and ask for supervisor. No supervisor available. The girl I talked with then said that the driver claimed he came and we were not there. We had been there the whole time. She said she would send him back. FINALLY, the shuttle arrives. It is now going on midnight. To top it off, the driver gets argumentative with us claiming he had been there and we were not there. We know where we were! Said he was on his way home and got called and had to come back. Kept saying he had been there 16 years and never left anyone behind. Very rude and annoying. Might think about just apologizing. They gave us a gift certificate towards room service for $25 but expect more from a hotel charging more than $300 per night. Agree with others about the fridge and wi-fi.
reviews.title: Service Needs Improvement

reviews.text: The Vinoy, built 1925, in downtown St Petersburg Florida has always been a favorite of mine though I hadn't been back since the 90's.
reviews.title: Great location, historic hotel, plenty of staff available equals a great stay.

reviews.text: Well my memory served me right. This place is a charming hotel steeped in history but well designed and perfectly staffed. The hotel was last renovated in 2010 and was very well done. The porch and lobby public areas are well done design wise and felt a very comfortable place to be.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room #104 was spacious,well appointed and spotless. The only thing that I wanted was a USB plug in for my phone. Other than that the room was great.
reviews.title: An other enjoyable stay at the Vinoy

reviews.text: Service was outstanding. There always seemed to be an abundance of staff. Even the auto valet which is often a sore spot of some hotels were awesome.
reviews.title: Very Nice

aka: Renaissance Vinoy Resort And Golf Club Hotel St. Petersburg
description: Classic Bayfront Resort comprising restored Vinoy Park Hotel & Tower (1992).
